message:
Hello guys, I don't know if many of you know about this, but I think it's really useful:
This is Google's Guide to Technical Development
It has a lot of useful courses and mainly important topics in Computer Science for anyone unsure what to do. It's not perfect and it lacks some stuff and doesn't mention C#/C++ which I think is super weird (but hey it's Google) but for the most part it's covers most of the basics.
Sorry if this was posted here before.
story: Mohamed Oun shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Students - Guide to Technical Development - Google Careers
caption: google.com
description: This guide provides tips and resources to help you develop your technical skills (academically and non-academically) through self-paced, hands-on learning.

data.message: ذاكرهم إنت أهم حاجة وبعدين شوف قصة الـ C++ :D

It actually mentions C++. 
I will tell you something about programming languages ..... 

1. There are what is called Langauge Family ... 
It's  two or more languages that they look like each other .. 
Example the C family. It has C, C++,C# , Java and maybe more that I don't know .
So learn one language from popular families .. 
Learn Classical OOP model langauge , learn interpreted dynamic language, learn a functional language .. 
Don't learn more than one language from the same family.
Ex. If you know C# and you wanna learn Java for the sake of learning Java you are wasting time.

2. It actually doesn't matter which programming language do you use ... It's the concepts and techniques that language expose ..
They do mention C++ btw but because they're Google, they won't advice you to learn a langnuge that's not supported very well on all the OSs
